means: [地名] [美国、南非共和国] 阿德万斯

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"前进，行进，进展"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: advance, progress, proceed, move on, go
means: advance ：主要用于具体的人或物，也可指科学技术和运动等。
progress ：指按某一既定目标前进，取得发展，目的性很明确，强调经常和稳定地前进。
move on ：非正式用语，侧重从某一停止点向某地前进，但不表示前进的目的地。
go ：最常用词，含义宽泛而不确切，依上文确定其具体意思。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都含"促进，推进"之意。
means: further ： 中性词，既可指对好事的促进、推进，又可指对坏事的助长。
advance ： 通常指为加速某一进程或达到某个预期目的而给予有效的促进，强调作出有意识、决定性的努力。
promote ： 指在某一进程的任何时期或阶段提供积极的帮助与支持。
contribute ： 指能促进事物向前发展的因素，但这种因素并非决定性的。
push ： 口语用词，通常指利用自己的活动或影响推进某事。

word_mean: 做徙前术：施行向前移的手术
堵口工程节节进堵的实施过程。

sentence.Network_en: It is a good idea to place your order well in advance.
sentence.Network_cn: 早早就提前下单是个好主意。

sentence.Network_en: Clients normally pay fees in advance, monthly, quarterly, or yearly.
sentence.Network_cn: 客户通常按月、季度或年度预付费用。

sentence.Network_en: Generally, warm colours advance in painting and cold colours recede.
sentence.Network_cn: 通常，绘画中暖色调为近感色，而冷色调为远感色。

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...而很多人都认为A字代表的是“”（angle）“能干”（able）“可敬佩的”（admirable）“前进”（advance）“艺术”（art）“爱情”（amorous）等等.最后，出于对所爱之人的之情，她不但在生前不肯远离他.

公共英语四级大纲词汇[1]_百度文库 ... adult n. 成年，成人 advance n. 前进；进步 advanced a. 年高的；程度高的.

高级版本程式 advance version program高级；进阶；先进 advanced高级声响信号处理机 advanced acoustic signal processor，AASP.
vitrification of shoots in ornamental plants and advances in its prevention and cure ., 观赏植物试管苗玻璃化现象及防治研究进展.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old French avance (noun), avancer (verb), from late Latin abante 'in front', from ab 'from' + ante 'before'. The initial a- was erroneously assimilated to ad-in the 16th cent

entry.def: To advance means to move forward, often in order to attack someone.

example.ex: Reports from Chad suggest that rebel forces are advancing on the capital...
example.tran: 来自乍得的报告显示叛军正向首都推进。

example.ex: The water is advancing at a rate of 5cm a day...
example.tran: 水位正以每天5厘米的速度上升。

entry.def: To advance means to make progress, especially in your knowledge of something.

example.ex: Medical technology has advanced considerably...
example.tran: 医学技术突飞猛进。

example.ex: Japan has advanced from a rural, feudal society to an urban, industrial power.
example.tran: 日本已从封建农业社会发展成一个城市化工业强国。

entry.def: If you advance someone a sum of money, you lend it to them, or pay it to them earlier than arranged.

example.ex: I advanced him some money, which he would repay on our way home...
example.tran: 我先借给他一些钱，在我们回家的路上他会还给我的。

example.ex: The bank advanced $1.2 billion to help the country with debt repayments.
example.tran: 银行预支12亿美元帮助该国偿还债务。

entry.def: An advance is money which is lent or paid to someone before they would normally receive it.

example.ex: She was paid a £100,000 advance for her next two novels.
example.tran: 她接下来的两部小说得到了10万英镑的预付稿费。

entry.tran: 提前（未来事件的日期）；使（未来事件）提前发生
entry.def: To advance an event, or the time or date of an event, means to bring it forward to an earlier time or date.

example.ex: Too much protein in the diet may advance the ageing process...
example.tran: 饮食中摄入过量蛋白质可能会加速衰老。

example.ex: The country's election commission has advanced the date of parliamentary elections by three days.
example.tran: 该国的选举委员会将议会选举日期提前了3天。

entry.tran: 促进，推动（事业、利益或主张）；使加速
entry.def: If you advance a cause, interest, or claim, you support it and help to make it successful.

example.ex: When not producing art of his own, Oliver was busy advancing the work of others.
example.tran: 奥利弗在不搞自己的艺术创作时，就会忙着帮助别人完成作品。

entry.def: When a theory or argument is advanced, it is put forward for discussion.

example.ex: Many theories have been advanced as to why some women suffer from depression...
example.tran: 就一些女性患抑郁症的原因，各种说法纷至沓来。

example.ex: An important set of ideas have been advanced by the biologist Rupert Sheldrake.
example.tran: 生物学家鲁珀特·谢尔德雷克已提出了一整套重要的观点。

entry.tran: （常指军事行动中的）前进，行进，推进
entry.def: An advance is a forward movement of people or vehicles, usually as part of a military operation.

example.ex: ...an advance on enemy positions...
example.tran: 向敌方阵地推进

example.ex: The defences are intended to obstruct any advance by tanks and other vehicles.
example.tran: 这些防御工事用于阻止坦克等车辆前进。

entry.def: If you make advances to someone, you try to start a sexual relationship with them.

example.ex: Mark had for some time been making advances towards her...
example.tran: 马克追她已经有一段时间了。

example.ex: She rejected his advances during the trip to Cannes.
example.tran: 在去往戛纳的途中，她拒绝了他的挑逗。

entry.def: An advance in a particular subject or activity is progress in understanding it or in doing it well.

example.ex: Air safety has not improved since the dramatic advances of the 1970s...
example.tran: 航空安全自从20世纪70年代得到显著提高之后，至今再没有任何改善。

example.ex: Their progress at work was mirrored by their children's educational advance.
example.tran: 子女在学业上有所进步，他们在工作上也就会有所起色。

entry.def: If something is an advance on what was previously available or done, it is better in some way.

example.ex: This could be an advance on the present situation.
example.tran: 这样可能会改善当前状况。

entry.def: Advance booking, notice, or warning is done or given before an event happens.

example.ex: They don't normally give any advance notice about which building they're going to inspect...
example.tran: 他们一般不会预先通知检查哪座大楼。

example.ex: The event received little advance publicity.
example.tran: 关于该事件事先几乎没有报道。

entry.def: An advance party or group is a small group of people who go on ahead of the main group.

example.ex: The 20-strong advance party will be followed by another 600 soldiers as part of UN relief efforts.
example.tran: 作为联合国救援行动的一部分，在这支由20多人组成的先头部队之后还将增派600名士兵。

entry.def: If one thing happens or is done in advance of another, it happens or is done before the other thing.

example.ex: I had asked everyone to submit questions in advance of the meeting.
example.tran: 我已请每个人在会议之前提交问题。

entry.def: If you do something in advance, you do it before a particular date or event.

example.ex: The subject of the talk is announced a week in advance.
example.tran: 会谈的主题已提前一周宣布。

sentences.sentence: "he listened for the progress of the troops"

means.word_mean: 2. a change for the better; progress in development
3. a tentative suggestion designed to elicit the reactions of others;
4. the act of moving forward toward a goal
5. an amount paid before it is earned

sentences.sentence: "the news caused a general advance on the stock market"

means.word_mean: 1. move forward, also in the metaphorical sense;
2. bring forward for consideration or acceptance;

sentences.sentence: "boost the voltage in an electrical circuit"

means.word_mean: 4. contribute to the progress or growth of;

sentences.sentence: "I am promoting the use of computers in the classroom"
"Can you move the car seat forward?"

means.word_mean: 6. obtain advantages, such as points, etc.;

sentences.sentence: "After defeating the Knicks, the Blazers pulled ahead of the Lakers in the battle for the number-one playoff berth in the Western Conference"

means.word_mean: 9. give a promotion to or assign to a higher position;

sentences.sentence: "John was kicked upstairs when a replacement was hired"
"Women tend not to advance in the major law firms"
"I got promoted after many years of hard work"
"we have to advance clocks and watches when we travel eastward"

means.word_mean: 1. being ahead of time or need;

sentences.sentence: "at that time the most advanced outpost was still east of the Rockies"

auth_sentence.content: The dried fish needs to be prepared in advance.
auth_sentence.res_content: The dried fish needs to be prepared in advance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The dried fish needs to be prepared in advance.

auth_sentence.content: For many, their fate is known in advance.
auth_sentence.res_content: For many, their fate is known in advance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For many, their fate is known in advance.

auth_sentence.content: The hillmen offered a stubborn resistance to the advance.
auth_sentence.res_content: The hillmen offered a stubborn resistance to the advance.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The hillmen offered a stubborn resistance to the advance.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 高级的, 年老的, 先进的
stems_affixes.word_buile: advance[n.&v.前进, 提升]+ed表形容词→adj.高级的, 年老的, 先进的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 渐消失的, 易消散的, 会凋零的
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+van空+escent开始……的→开始空出去的→渐消失的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 徒然的, 无益的, 虚荣的, 空虚的
stems_affixes.word_buile: vain=van空→adj.徒然的, 无益的, 虚荣的, 空虚的
van空+ity表名词→心里空空→虚荣心

stems_affixes.value_cn: 逐渐消失, 容易消失, 幻灭, 瞬息
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+van空+escency开始→开始空出去→渐消失
ad向+van前卫,先锋+ce→n.&v.前进, 提升

Sentence.sentence: Fire was one of the earliest major technological advances for humankind, providing heat, protection, and cooked food (which is much easier to cat and digest).

Parents and students who have invested heavily in higher education worry about graduates' job prospects as technological advances and changes in domestic and global markets transform professions in ways that reduce wages and cut jobs
Useful thinking skills for advanced academic research.
But this vote of confidence in Oprah sends a troubling message at precisely the time when American universities need to do more to advance the cause of reason.
As sisters and brothers advanced into old age, closeness increases and rivalry diminishes, explains VC, a psychologist at Purdue University.
It is essential to advanced manufacturing.

sentences.en: I signed to him to keep away, but he continued to advance.
sentences.cn: 我示意他离开, 但他还是继续往前走。

sentences.en: She advanced greatly in her knowledge.

sentences.cn: 他提出了许多合理化建议。

sentences.en: They advanced the time of the meeting.
sentences.cn: 他们把会议时间提前了。

sentences.en: I advanced 200 pounds more on these books.
sentences.cn: 这些书我又多预付了200英镑。

sentences.en: Clocks must be advanced one hour.
The banks often advance money to farmers for seed and fertilizer.
sentences.cn: 银行通常贷款给农民购买种子和化肥。

means.word_mean: 前进, 发展, 改进, 进步

sentences.en: Nothing could stop the advance of the soldiers.
sentences.cn: 什么也无法阻挡战士们的前进步伐。

sentences.en: There has been no advance in the price of rice for many years.
sentences.cn: 许多年来米价一直没有上涨。

means.word_mean: 借款, 预付款, 贷款

sentences.en: The factory gave me an advance so that I could get my necessities.
sentences.cn: 工厂先付钱给我, 便于我买一些必需品。

sentences.en: We sent out an advance party of soldiers.
sentences.cn: 我们派出一支先头部队。

means.word_mean: 预先做好的; 预先供给的

sentences.en: They have got advance information of the storm's approach.
sentences.cn: 他们事前已得到将有暴风雨的消息。

means.word_mean: 【体育】(在锦标赛中)获胜后进入下一轮比赛

sentences.en: He advanced into the second round.
sentences.cn: 他获胜进入第二轮比赛。

jushi.english: The procession advanced with a slow step.
From that time on, seicnce advanced more quickly.
jushi.chinese: 从那时起,科学发展更快了。

jushi.english: If prices continue to advance, poor people will find it hard to live.
jushi.chinese: 如果物价继续上涨,穷人的日子就更不好过了。
